In triangle ABC, side $a = \sqrt{3}$, side $b = \sqrt{3}$, and side $c > 3$. Let $x$ be the largest number such that the magnitude, in degrees, of the angle opposite side $c$ exceeds $x$. Then $x$ equals:\\
\\
$\textbf{(A)}\ 150 \qquad
\textbf{(B)}\ 120\qquad
\textbf{(C)}\ 105 \qquad
\textbf{(D)}\ 90 \qquad
\textbf{(E)}\ 60$
